intro: Ricinocarpos major, commonly known as the giant rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, ovate leaves and is typically found in arid and rocky environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in spring. Its seeds are enclosed in a capsule that splits open to release the seeds. Ricinocarpos major is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
